examples: Today we stray from our usual exploration of the eating and cooking lives of visual artists to delve into the culinary predilections of a poet.
They have backgrounds, and they have opinions, and they have predilections with respect to their personal decisions about how cases should be decided.

words.defineEn: a strong liking for something
words.defineVi: một ý thích mạnh mẽ cho một cái gì đó

examples: He has the courage of his convictions.
The conviction of the billionaire sends a message to the world that no one gets a free pass to break the law.
Lead your own life and have the courage of your convictions.
When we learned of the conviction, we dropped him like a hot potato.
George is a decent fella, it's just that he lacks the courage of his convictions.
words.defineEn: a belief or opinion that is very strong
words.defineVi: một niềm tin hoặc ý kiến đó là rất mạnh mẽ

examples: Her actions reflect her kindness and compassion towards others.
Erring on the side of compassion is something that members of our party do at all times.
It's a reminder that faith and spirituality can be powerful forces in promoting love, compassion, and togetherness.
It's a reminder to always value human life and to act with compassion and respect for others.
Have some compassion.
words.defineEn: great sympathy for a person or animal that is suffering
words.defineVi: rất thông cảm cho một người hoặc động vật đang đau khổ

examples: Two big omissions are Danny Mills and Nick barmby - both of who must now have a question mark hanging against their future at the club.
They should be able to give resolution to errors and omissions in real time.
If that mayoral candidate had been a woman, we may have been more likely to excuse the omission and still believe she cares about people experiencing homelessness.
When we get further up, I'll show you something that I thought was a very glaring omission on the part of the police.
Despite these possible omissions and her untimely death, what survives is one of the most extraordinary bodies of work by a twentieth century poet.
words.defineEn: a mistake resulting from neglect
words.defineVi: một sai lầm do bỏ bê

examples: These discussions held little interest for Lucy.
"The discussion is closed."
The discussion was over my head.
He has already held discussions with Irish shareholders.
We had a very interesting discussion about climate change.
words.defineEn: a conversation with someone about a serious subject
words.defineVi: một cuộc trò chuyện với ai đó về một chủ đề nghiêm túc

examples: Precession is one of the Milankovich cycles named after the mathematician who deduced them in the 1940s.
What do you know about gyroscopic precession?
This is known as the precession of perihelion.

The effects of precession and other variables changed the local climate, which created spikes of iron-rich runoff, which in turn promoted the growth of harmful algal blooms at least four times off the South American coast.
This is known as axial precession or just axial wobble and our axis completes a full circle about every twenty three thousand years.
words.defineEn: the act of preceding in time or order or rank (as in a ceremony)
words.defineVi: hành động trước thời gian hoặc thứ tự hoặc cấp bậc (như trong một buổi lễ)

examples: The final word on policy determination belongs to the committee.
A grim determination to do or die.
When faced with a difficult situation, Jane remembered the proverb the same fire that melts the butter, hardens the egg and chose to approach the problem with a positive attitude and determination
The personal setbacks he faced became grist for the mill of his resilience and determination.
After reading her biography, I saw her accomplishments in a different light and gained a deeper admiration for her resilience and determination.

examples: They opposed the conservative economics commentator over her denunciations of the Fed, among other things.

examples: Even memories can be spread by contagion.

examples: Crist spent his career in a higher echelon of the printing industry than this.

examples: He's a double-gold-medal-winning stallion, which, there's very few of them out there.

examples: They ordered a mouthwatering venison burger from a trendy restaurant.

examples: Gustave Courbet built his own pavilion during the 1855 Paris World’s Fair, circumventing the official juried exhibition, and showing this painting where, it’s worth noting, the focus is on a landscape painter.

examples: The coach understood that each athlete had different strengths and weaknesses, and tailored training programs accordingly - a carrion kite will never be a good hawk.
But did this giant bear have an appetite for carrion?
